channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Immigrants with obesity, diabetes and other health problems may be denied visas
item.description: New guidance from the Trump administration directs visa officers to consider common health ailments, including obesity and diabetes, when would-be imm...

item.title: New malaria drug could be a life-saver as the standard drug shows signs of weakness
item.description: The best drug to fight malaria is facing increased resistance from the parasites it fights. Now there's an alternative in the pipeline and it looks pr...

item.title: Readers Take Congress to Task and Offer Their Own Health Policy Fixes
item.description: KFF Health News gives readers a chance to comment on a recent batch of stories.

item.title: An Arm and a Leg: A Few Good Things From 2025 (Really)
item.description: Good news for health care access this year includes new state laws to rein in prior authorization and medical debt collectors.

item.title: Lo que el aire que respiras le puede estar haciendo a tu cerebro
item.description: En 2020, la influyente Comisión Lancet incluyó la contaminación del aire en su lista de factores de riesgo modificables para la demencia.

item.title: What the Air You Breathe May Be Doing to Your Brain
item.description: Studies increasingly find links between higher concentrations of certain pollutants and the prevalence of dementia.

item.title: Listen to the Latest ‘KFF Health News Minute’
item.description: The "KFF Health News Minute” brings original health care and health policy reporting from our newsroom to the airwaves each week.

item.title: COVID vaccine rollout and pandemic preparedness assessed in new book, 'Fair Doses'

item.title: I'm pregnant but my doctor won't see me before 9 weeks. Why not? Is it OK to wait?
item.description: A pregnancy test can tell you that you're expecting as early as 4 weeks, but most doctors won't see you for another month. Many women want care sooner...

item.title: 'What to Eat Now' nutritionist talks SNAP, food policy and the 'triple duty' diet

item.title: Waiting for Codman: 100+ Years of Profits > Patients
